select
from sys_dept_post dp, sys_post p where dp.dept_id = #{query.deptId} and p.post_id = dp.post_id
from sys_post p where 1 = 1
and p.post_type = #{query.postType}
and p.post_name like concat('%', #{query.postName}, '%')
order by p.post_type, p.post_id

select
from sys_dept_post dp, sys_post p where dp.dept_id = #{query.deptId} and p.post_id = dp.post_id
from sys_post p where 1 = 1
and p.post_type = #{query.postType}
and p.post_name like concat('%', #{query.postName}, '%')
order by p.post_type, p.post_id

select t.parent_id parentId,
from sys_post p left join sys_post_tree t on p.post_id = t.post_id where p.post_id = #{postId}
select u.user_id userId, u.user_name userName from sys_user u, sys_post p, sys_user_dept up where p.post_code = #{postCode} and p.post_id = up.post_id and up.user_id = u.user_id

with recursive tree (post_id, parent_id) as (select t1.post_id, t1.parent_id from sys_post_tree t1 where post_id = #{postId} union select t2.post_id, t2.parent_id from sys_post_tree t2 join tree on t2.parent_id = tree.post_id) select distinct tree.post_id from tree JOIN sys_post u on tree.post_id = u.post_id

select sys_post_tree.post_id id, sys_post_tree.parent_id pid, sys_post.post_name as label from sys_post_tree left join sys_post ON sys_post_tree.post_id = sys_post.post_id order by sys_post_tree.parent_id, sys_post_tree.post_id
select dept_name || '/' || post_name from sys_dept, sys_post where dept_id = #{deptId} and post_id = #{postId}
